items.synopsis: Many of us are now dressed head to toe in plastic thanks to the invention of cheap and durable textiles like polyester. But the extent of the environmental impact from these garments might surprise you — we've tracked the life cycle of a polyester top from an oil field, through to when you chuck it in the bin.

title.children: Gym clothes, party dresses, work clothes — most of us are wearing plastic. What goes into making a polyester T-shirt?

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: The federal senate inquiry into Australia's preparedness to host international sporting events will travel to regional Victoria today. On what will be the second day of the public hearing, witnesses from cities which were to host the ill-fated 2026 Commonwealth Games will give evidence in Bendigo. Athletics Australia director Steve Moneghetti is among sports executives expected to provide a testimony. Yesterday, the inquiry heard from Gold Coast Mayor Tom Tate, who flagged Queensland as a potential host for the 2026 Games.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Commonwealth Games inquiry to visit Victoria

children.content: The federal senate inquiry into Australia's preparedness to host international sporting events will travel to regional Victoria today.
On what will be the second day of the public hearing, witnesses from cities which were to host the ill-fated 2026 Commonwealth Games will give evidence in Bendigo.
Athletics Australia director Steve Moneghetti is among sports executives expected to provide a testimony.
Yesterday, the inquiry heard from Gold Coast Mayor Tom Tate, who flagged Queensland as a potential host for the 2026 Games.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: A magnitude 7.1 earthquake has struck the Bali Sea region of Indonesia in the early hours of the morning. Its epicentre was 201 kilometres north of the city of Mataram on the island of Lombok — and 518 kilometres below the surface. No tsunami warning has been issued for the region. The quake was felt in Bali, with many people there taking to social media to say they were woken by the shaking.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Earthquake strikes near Indonesia

children.content: A magnitude 7.1 earthquake has struck the Bali Sea region of Indonesia in the early hours of the morning.
Its epicentre was 201 kilometres north of the city of Mataram on the island of Lombok — and 518 kilometres below the surface.
No tsunami warning has been issued for the region.
The quake was felt in Bali, with many people there taking to social media to say they were woken by the shaking.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Spain's football governing body has asked its besieged president Luis Rubiales to resign. The announcement follows prosecutors launching a sexual assault investigation into his kissing of player Jenni Hermoso. After a marathon meeting in Madrid that stretched until after 10pm local time, the Royal Spanish Football Federation issued a statement demanding he quit. They say Mr Rubiales' "unacceptable behaviour" had "seriously damaged" the sport. You can read the latest on this story from Riley Stuart in London here:
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Spanish soccer boss asked to quit over 'unaceptable' kiss

featuredLink.title: Besieged Spanish soccer boss asked to quit amid sex assault probe and mother's hunger strike

children.content: Spain's football governing body has asked its besieged president
Luis Rubiales
to resign.
The announcement follows prosecutors launching a sexual assault investigation into his kissing of player
Jenni Hermoso

children.content: Luis Rubiales.
(RFEF via Reuters)
After a marathon meeting in Madrid that stretched until after 10pm local time, the Royal Spanish Football Federation issued
a statement demanding he quit.
They say Mr Rubiales' "unacceptable behaviour" had "seriously damaged" the sport.

items.synopsis: Local stocks are poised to add to Monday's gains. Incoming RBA governor Michele Bullock will speak after the close of trade. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX set to rise after US, European stocks gain

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Workers at Chevron's Australian liquefied natural gas operations are planning "rolling stoppages, bans and limitations" from September 7, as pay negotiations continue. In a social media post, the Offshore Alliance, which is a partnership between the Australian Workers' Union and the Maritime Union of Australia, said its lawyers had served Chevron with a formal notice of protected industrial action. The Alliance slammed Chevron's bargaining efforts and said the actions would escalate each week until bargaining claims are agreed to. "While we don't believe that industrial action is necessary for agreement to be reached, we recognise employees have the right to take protected industrial action," Chevron said in a statement to Reuters. "We will continue to take steps to maintain safe and reliable operations in the event of disruption at our facilities."
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: Chevron LNG workers plan industrial action

children.content: Workers at Chevron's Australian liquefied natural gas operations are planning "rolling stoppages, bans and limitations" from September 7, as pay negotiations continue.

In a social media post, the Offshore Alliance, which is a partnership between the Australian Workers' Union and the Maritime Union of Australia, said its lawyers had served Chevron with a formal notice of protected industrial action.
The Alliance slammed Chevron's bargaining efforts and said the actions would escalate each week until bargaining claims are agreed to.

"While we don't believe that industrial action is necessary for agreement to be reached, we recognise employees have the right to take protected industrial action," Chevron said in a statement to Reuters.
"We will continue to take steps to maintain safe and reliable operations in the event of disruption at our facilities."

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Good morning, Stephanie Chalmers here to take you through another day on markets. And it looks like it could be a positive start, adding to yesterday's rise, with ASX futures higher. It follows US markets making gains overnight, while Europe's Stoxx 600 posted its best rise in a month. Wall Street and European markets had a positive lead from the Asian session yesterday, where news of more stimulus measures from Beijing to support housing and stock trading buoyed trade. Locally, the major focus will be after the market closes, with incoming Reserve Bank governor Michele Bullock speaking in Canberra this evening. The topic of her speech is 'Climate Change and Central Banks' but her commentary will be closely-watched for any clues about the RBA's path ahead of her taking over the top job mid-September. Stick with us for more news and analysis through the day!
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: ASX eyes another gain
